Package org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic

Interface TaskGraphExecutorFactory

public interface TaskGraphExecutorFactory
Defines factory creating TaskGraphExecutor for a given task graph.

Thread safety

The method of this interface can be called from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

The methods of this class are not required to be synchronization transparent.
See Also:
  • CollectingTaskGraphBuilder
  • TaskGraphExecutor
  • TaskGraphExecutors

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    TaskGraphExecutor
    createExecutor(DependencyDag<TaskNodeKey<?,?>> taskGraph, Iterable<? extends TaskNode<?,?>> nodes)
    Returns a new TaskGraphExecutor able to execute the given task graph.

  • Method Details

    • createExecutor

      TaskGraphExecutor createExecutor(DependencyDag<TaskNodeKey<?,?>> taskGraph, Iterable<? extends TaskNode<?,?>> nodes)
      Returns a new TaskGraphExecutor able to execute the given task graph. The passed task nodes are already prepared to read their input assuming that their dependencies were successfully computed.
      Parameters:
      taskGraph - the graph defining the dependencies between task nodes. This argument cannot be null.
      nodes - the nodes of the graph to be executed with respect to their dependencies. This argument cannot be null and may not contain null elements.
      Returns:
      a new TaskGraphExecutor able to execute the given task graph. This method never returns null.
